name: nyancat Juju charm
description:
Nyancat telnet server

Nyancat, available as a convenient telnet service!
Nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan

inetd-service.description: Named service (in /etc/services) to listen on through inetd

license:
# Overview

Nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan 
nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan.

Nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan 
nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan.

Nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan 
nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan 
nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan 
nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan.

Nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan 
nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan 
nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan 
nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan.


# Usage

Simply run:

    juju deploy nyancat
    juju expose nyancat

You may add multiple units, but keep in mind there are no relationships 
between them, so they operate as independent units.

Then simply:

    telnet <ip>


# Configuration

Please see the charm store for configuration variables.


# Contact Information

Charm author: Ryan Finnie <ryan.finnie@canonical.com>  
Report bugs at: http://bugs.launchpad.net/charms  
Location: http://jujucharms.com

Upstream author: Kevin Lange <k@dakko.us>  
Upstream git repo: https://github.com/klange/nyancat
